queries.query: SELECT ( CASE pg_is_in_recovery() WHEN 'f' THEN 't' ELSE 'f' END );

columns.description: Is the PostgreSQL instance the primary

queries.query: SELECT datname, pg_database_size(datname) FROM pg_database;

SELECT pg_database.datname as database, tmp.mode, COALESCE(count, 0) as count FROM ( VALUES ('accesssharelock'), ('rowsharelock'), ('rowexclusivelock'), ('shareupdateexclusivelock'), ('sharelock'), ('sharerowexclusivelock'), ('exclusivelock'), ('accessexclusivelock'), ('sireadlock') ) AS tmp(mode) CROSS JOIN pg_database LEFT JOIN ( SELECT database, lower(mode) AS mode, count(*) AS count FROM pg_locks WHERE database IS NOT NULL GROUP BY database, lower(mode) ) AS tmp2 ON tmp.mode = tmp2.mode AND pg_database.oid = tmp2.database ORDER BY 1, 2;
SELECT slot_name, slot_type, database, active, temporary FROM pg_replication_slots;
SELECT buffers_alloc, buffers_clean, maxwritten_clean FROM pg_stat_bgwriter;

WITH metrics AS ( SELECT application_name, SUM(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - state_change))::bigint)::float AS process_idle_seconds_sum, COUNT(*) AS process_idle_seconds_count FROM pg_stat_activity WHERE state = 'idle' GROUP BY application_name ), buckets AS ( SELECT application_name, le, SUM( CASE WHEN EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - state_change)) <= le THEN 1 ELSE 0 END )::bigint AS bucket FROM pg_stat_activity, UNNEST(ARRAY[1, 2, 5, 15, 30, 60, 90, 120, 300]) AS le GROUP BY application_name, le ORDER BY application_name, le ) SELECT application_name, process_idle_seconds_sum as seconds_sum, process_idle_seconds_count as seconds_count, ARRAY_AGG(le) AS seconds, ARRAY_AGG(bucket) AS seconds_bucket FROM metrics JOIN buckets USING (application_name) GROUP BY 1, 2, 3;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS extensions FROM pg_available_extensions;

columns.description: Number of available extensions for installation.

queries.query: SELECT array_agg(extname) AS extensions, count(*) FROM pg_extension;
SELECT sourcefile, COUNT(*), ( CASE applied WHEN 't' THEN 'true' ELSE 'false' END ) as applied FROM pg_file_settings WHERE applied = 't' GROUP BY sourcefile, applied;
SELECT schemaname, tablename, COUNT(*) FROM pg_indexes GROUP BY schemaname,tablename;

columns.description: Indexes for each schemaname for each tablename.

queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM pg_matviews WHERE ispopulated = 't' GROUP BY ispopulated;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM pg_roles;
SELECT tablename, COUNT(*) FROM pg_rules GROUP BY tablename;

SELECT ( CASE WHEN rolpassword LIKE 'md5%' THEN 'MD5' WHEN rolpassword LIKE 'SCRAM-SHA-256$%' THEN 'SCRAM-SHA-256' ELSE 'UNENCRYPTED' END ) AS encryption_type, COUNT(*) FROM pg_authid WHERE rolname != 'postgres' GROUP BY encryption_type;

columns.description: Number of users with authentication type.

queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM pg_event_trigger JOIN pg_authid ON pg_event_trigger.oid = pg_authid.oid WHERE rolname != 'postgres';

columns.description: Number of user defined event triggers.

queries.query: SELECT datname, count(*) FROM pg_stat_activity WHERE datname IS NOT NULL GROUP BY datname;
SELECT datname, count(*) FROM pg_stat_ssl JOIN pg_stat_activity ON pg_stat_activity.pid = pg_stat_ssl.pid WHERE ssl = 't' AND datname IS NOT NULL GROUP BY datname;

columns.description: Number of DB connections with SSL.

queries.query: SELECT COUNT(heap_blks_read) AS heap_blks_read, COUNT(heap_blks_hit) AS heap_blks_hit, COUNT(idx_blks_read) as idx_blks_read, COUNT(idx_blks_hit) AS idx_blks_hit, COUNT(toast_blks_read) AS toast_blks_read, COUNT(toast_blks_hit) AS toast_blks_hit, COUNT(tidx_blks_read) AS tidx_blks_read, COUNT(tidx_blks_hit) AS tidx_blks_hit FROM pg_statio_all_tables;

columns.name: heap_blks_read
columns.description: Number of disk blocks read in postgres db.

columns.name: heap_blks_hit
columns.description: Number of buffer hits read in postgres db.

columns.name: idx_blks_read
columns.description: Number of disk blocks reads from all indexes in postgres db.

columns.name: idx_blks_hit
columns.description: Number of buffer hits read from all indexes in postgres db.

columns.name: toast_blks_read
columns.description: Number of disk blocks reads from postgres db's TOAST tables.

columns.name: toast_blks_hit
columns.description: Number of buffer hits read from postgres db's TOAST tables.

columns.name: tidx_blks_read
columns.description: Number of disk blocks reads from postgres db's TOAST table indexes.

columns.name: tidx_blks_hit
columns.description: Number of buffer hits read from postgres db's TOAST table indexes.

queries.query: SELECT COUNT(blks_read) AS blks_read, COUNT(blks_hit) AS blks_hit FROM pg_statio_all_sequences;

columns.name: blks_read
columns.description: Number of disk blocks read from sequences in postgres db.

columns.name: blks_hit
columns.description: Number of buffer hits read from sequences in postgres db.

queries.query: SELECT funcname, calls, self_time, total_time FROM pg_stat_user_functions;

columns.name: calls
columns.description: Number of times function is called.

columns.name: self_time
columns.description: Total time spent in milliseconds on the function itself.

columns.name: total_time
columns.description: Total time spent in milliseconds by the function and any other functions called by it.

queries.query: SELECT calls, query FROM pg_stat_statements ORDER BY calls DESC LIMIT 10;

columns.description: Number of times the SQL query is executed.

queries.query: SELECT rows, query FROM pg_stat_statements ORDER BY rows DESC LIMIT 10;

columns.description: Number of rows the SQL query affects.

queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*), application_name FROM pg_stat_replication WHERE state = 'streaming' GROUP BY application_name;

columns.description: Number of streaming WAL connections per application.

queries.query: SELECT archived_count, (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - last_archived_time)) * 1000)::bigint AS success_time_elapsed_ms, failed_count, (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - last_failed_time)) * 1000)::bigint AS failure_time_elapsed_ms FROM pg_stat_archiver;

columns.name: archived_count
columns.description: Number of successful archived WAL files.

columns.name: success_time_elapsed_ms
columns.description: Milliseconds since successful archived WAL file.

columns.name: archived_count
columns.description: Number of failed archival operation on WAL files.

columns.name: archived_count
columns.description: Milliseconds since last failed archival operation on WAL files.

queries.query: SELECT datname, age(datfrozenxid) as age FROM pg_database;
SELECT c.oid::regclass as table_name, greatest(age(c.relfrozenxid),age(t.relfrozenxid)) as age FROM pg_class c LEFT JOIN pg_class t ON c.reltoastrelid = t.oid WHERE c.relkind IN ('r', 'm');

SELECT CASE WHEN sender_host LIKE '/%' THEN sender_host ELSE sender_host || ':' || sender_port::text END AS sender, (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - last_msg_send_time)) * 1000)::bigint AS time_elapsed_ms FROM pg_stat_wal_receiver;

columns.description: Time since last message received from WAL sender

queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM pg_stat_gssapi JOIN pg_stat_activity ON pg_stat_gssapi.pid = pg_stat_activity.pid WHERE gss_authenticated = 't' AND datname IS NOT NULL;

columns.description: Number of GSSAPI authenticated DB connections.

queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM pg_stat_gssapi JOIN pg_stat_activity ON pg_stat_gssapi.pid = pg_stat_activity.pid WHERE encrypted = 't' AND datname IS NOT NULL;

SELECT SUM(sum) AS size_sum, '1' AS size_count, array_agg((bucket - 1) * (50000))::int[] AS size, array_agg(count)::int[] AS size_bucket FROM ( SELECT width_bucket(allocated_size, 0, 5000000, 100) AS bucket, COUNT(*), SUM(allocated_size) FROM pg_shmem_allocations GROUP BY bucket ORDER BY bucket ) t;
SELECT total_exec_time, query FROM pg_stat_statements ORDER BY total_exec_time DESC LIMIT 10;

columns.description: Milliseconds taken by the sql query to execute.

queries.query: SELECT plans, query FROM pg_stat_statements ORDER BY plans desc LIMIT 10;

columns.description: Number of times the sql query is planned.

queries.query: SELECT wal_bytes, query FROM pg_stat_statements ORDER BY wal_bytes desc LIMIT 10;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS contexts, parent, SUM(free_bytes) AS free_bytes, SUM(used_bytes) AS used_bytes, SUM(total_bytes) AS total_bytes FROM pg_backend_memory_contexts WHERE parent!='' GROUP BY parent;

columns.name: contexts
columns.description: Number of memory contexts per parent.

queries.query: SELECT wal_records, wal_fpi, wal_bytes, wal_buffers_full, wal_write, wal_sync, wal_write_time, wal_sync_time FROM pg_stat_wal;

columns.name: wal_fpi
columns.description: Number of WAL full page images generated.

columns.name: wal_buffers_full
columns.description: Number of disk writes due to WAL buffers being full.

columns.name: wal_write
columns.description: Number of times WAL files were written to disk.

columns.name: wal_sync
columns.description: Number of times WAL files were synced to disk.

columns.name: wal_write_time
columns.description: Time taken for WAL files to be written to disk.

columns.name: wal_sync_time
columns.description: Time taken for WAL files to be synced to disk.

queries.query: SELECT datname, blk_read_time, blk_write_time, blks_hit, blks_read, deadlocks, temp_files, temp_bytes, tup_returned, tup_fetched, tup_inserted, tup_updated, tup_deleted, xact_commit, xact_rollback, conflicts, numbackends FROM pg_stat_database WHERE datname IS NOT NULL ORDER BY datname;

SELECT datname, blk_read_time, blk_write_time, blks_hit, blks_read, deadlocks, temp_files, temp_bytes, tup_returned, tup_fetched, tup_inserted, tup_updated, tup_deleted, xact_commit, xact_rollback, conflicts, numbackends, checksum_failures FROM pg_stat_database WHERE datname IS NOT NULL ORDER BY datname;

SELECT datname, blk_read_time, blk_write_time, blks_hit, blks_read, deadlocks, temp_files, temp_bytes, tup_returned, tup_fetched, tup_inserted, tup_updated, tup_deleted, xact_commit, xact_rollback, conflicts, numbackends, checksum_failures, session_time, active_time, idle_in_transaction_time, sessions, sessions_abandoned, sessions_fatal, sessions_killed FROM pg_stat_database WHERE datname IS NOT NULL ORDER BY datname;
SELECT FLOOR( EXTRACT( EPOCH FROM (now() - stats_reset) ) ) FROM pg_stat_recovery_prefetch;

columns.description: Seconds from last WAL prefetch stats reset.

queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM pg_stat_gssapi JOIN pg_stat_activity ON pg_stat_gssapi.pid = pg_stat_activity.pid WHERE credentials_delegated = 't' AND datname IS NOT NULL;

columns.description: Number of DB connections with delegated GSSAPI credentials.

queries.query: SELECT backend_type, SUM(COALESCE(reads, 0)) AS reads, SUM(COALESCE(read_time, 0)) AS read_time, SUM(COALESCE(writes, 0)) AS writes, SUM(COALESCE(write_time, 0)) AS write_time, SUM(COALESCE(writebacks, 0)) AS writebacks, SUM(COALESCE(writeback_time, 0)) AS writeback_time, SUM(COALESCE(extends, 0)) AS extends, SUM(COALESCE(extend_time, 0)) AS extend_time, AVG(COALESCE(op_bytes, 0)) AS op_bytes, SUM(COALESCE(hits, 0)) AS hits, SUM(COALESCE(evictions, 0)) AS evictions, SUM(COALESCE(reuses, 0)) AS reuses, SUM(COALESCE(fsyncs, 0)) AS fsyncs, SUM(COALESCE(fsync_time, 0)) AS fsync_time FROM pg_stat_io GROUP BY backend_type;

columns.name: read_time
columns.description: Total time spent on read operations in milliseconds.

columns.name: write_time
columns.description: Total time spent on write operations in milliseconds.

columns.name: writebacks
columns.description: Number of writeback to permanent storage requests sent to kernel.

columns.name: writeback_time
columns.description: Total time spent on writeback operations in milliseconds.

columns.name: extend_time
columns.description: Total time spent on relation extend operations in milliseconds.

columns.name: op_bytes
columns.description: Bytes per unit of I/O read, written or extended.

columns.name: hits
columns.description: The number of times a desired block was found in shared buffer.

columns.name: evictions
columns.description: The number of times a block has been written out from shared or local buffer in order to make it available for another use.

columns.name: reuses
columns.description: The number of times an existing buffer in a size-limited ring buffer outside of shared buffers was reused as part of an I/O operation.

columns.name: fsync_time
columns.description: Total time spent on fsync operations in milliseconds.

queries.query: SELECT datname, confl_tablespace, confl_lock, confl_snapshot, confl_bufferpin, confl_deadlock FROM pg_stat_database_conflicts WHERE datname IS NOT NULL ORDER BY datname;
SELECT datname, confl_tablespace, confl_lock, confl_snapshot, confl_bufferpin, confl_deadlock, confl_active_logicalslot FROM pg_stat_database_conflicts WHERE datname IS NOT NULL ORDER BY datname;
SELECT SUM(idx_scan) AS idx_scans, SUM(idx_tup_read) AS idx_tup_reads, SUM(idx_tup_fetch) AS idx_tup_fetchs, relname FROM pg_stat_all_indexes GROUP BY relname;

columns.name: idx_scans
columns.description: Number of index scans on the table's indexes.

columns.name: idx_tup_reads
columns.description: Number of index entries returned by scans on the table's indexes.

columns.name: idx_tup_fetchs
columns.description: Number of rows fetched by simple index scans on the table's indexes.

queries.query: SELECT SUM(idx_scan) AS idx_scans, SUM(idx_tup_read) AS idx_tup_reads, SUM(idx_tup_fetch) AS idx_tup_fetchs, COALESCE(MIN((EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP - last_idx_scan)) * 1000)::bigint), 0) AS time_elapsed_ms, relname FROM pg_stat_all_indexes GROUP BY relname;

columns.name: idx_scans
columns.description: Number of index scans on the table's indexes.

columns.name: idx_tup_reads
columns.description: Number of index entries returned by scans on the table's indexes.

columns.name: idx_tup_fetchs
columns.description: Number of rows fetched by simple index scans on the table's indexes.

columns.name: time_elapsed_ms
columns.description: Milliseconds since last scan of an index in the table.

queries.query: SELECT type, count(*) as count FROM pg_wait_events GROUP BY type ORDER BY count DESC;
